main event: In November 1957, a UFO sighting was reported involving a triangle-shaped, flimsy-looking object seen at high altitude, revolving and then disappearing. It was initially suspected to be a kite due to its appearance and behavior.
interesting points: The object was described as flimsy and triangular in shape, resembling a basketball when viewed through binoculars.
Despite its initial assessment as a kite, the object was seen at high altitude and was reported to have revolving regularly.
The sighting lasted for approximately 1 minute, with no discernable traffic in the area.
A senior director and investigator witnessed a bright, sharply defined light larger than a star, which changed appearance before accelerating and disappearing.
The UFO report was part of the U.S. Air Force's Project Blue Book, a program that investigated unidentified flying object (UFO) sightings.
result: prosaic explanation - initially suspected to be a kite
sighted object: triangle-shaped, flimsy-looking object at high altitude
